Class RecursiveFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • RecursiveFunctions

  • public class RecursiveFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
    Recursive functions prints 0 - n with int n as the parameter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RecursiveFunctions() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This is the main method that calls the printNum() method with 5 being the parameter
      static void printNum(int n)
      This is the method where it takes int n as a parameter and then uses recursion to print 0-n with one number on each line.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method that calls the printNum() method with 5 being the parameter
        Parameters:
        String[] - args

      • printNum

        public static void printNum(int n)
        This is the method where it takes int n as a parameter and then uses recursion to print 0-n with one number on each line. The code will start at n and then if it is 0 or greater it uses recursion to do the same method but n goes down by 1. After it goes down below 0 and then it will just return nothing. Next the code will go back up by printing 0 then 1 and so on until n.
        Parameters:
        int - n is the integer that goes 0-n
